head.title: CSS Syntax and Selectors
head.desctiption: A CSS rule-set consists of a selecor and a declaration block

data: A CSS rule-set of a  selector and a declaration block:
The selector ponts to the HTML elements you want to style.
The declaration block contains one or more declarations separated by semicolons.
Each declaration includes a CSS property name and a value, separated by a colon.
A CSS decalaratin always ands with a semicolon, and declaration blocks are surrounded by curly braces.

data: CSS selectors are used to "find" (or select) HTML elements based on their elemnt name, id, class, attribute,and more.
The element selector selects elements based on the element name.

The id selector uses id attribute of an HTML element to select a specific element.
The id of an element should be unique within a page, so teh id selector is used to select one unique element!
To select an element with a specific idm write a hash (#) character, followed by the id of the element
